main event: On 19 March 1959, a civilian observer reported a round, white object with a greenish-blue trail, estimated to be the size of a golf ball, flying north and then disappearing into a cloud with a flash. The object was visible for approximately 5 seconds.
interesting points: The object was described as having a trail that was spread out and somewhat larger than the object itself.
The observer initially thought the object might be related to a jet trail but later concluded it did not.
Weather and winds aloft conditions at the time indicated clear visibility of 15 miles plus, with scattered clouds at lower altitudes.
The report mentions a prior sighting of a meteor, but the observer stated that the UFO did not resemble a meteor.
No intercept action was taken, and there was no air traffic reported in the area at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: Round, white object with a greenish-blue trail
location: 24 miles north of Max, North Dakota
